1. Introduction:
   a. The context of the data, domain, and/or field of application. 
   b. The source and/or reference of the data (where it was found, where/when it was previously 
used).
   c. The global objective of the project and data analysis (i.e., research question).  
1. Data description: 
   a. The features: variable names, their description, their modality, etc.
   b. The instances: what they represent (unit of observation), how many, etc.
   c. Any planned cleaning or data modification: removing, imputation, modality merging, etc.  
2. Planned analysis: 
   a. Supervised learning: models, splitting strategy, metrics, etc.
   b. (optional) Unsupervised learning: methods used, how they will interact with supervised learning.
